title: Introduction to Web Development
description: Learn the basics of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to start your web development journey
content: Web development is the process of creating websites and web applications. It involves three main technologies: HTML (HyperText Markup Language) for structure, CSS (Cascading Style Sheets) for styling, and JavaScript for interactivity. HTML provides the skeleton of web pages using elements like headings, paragraphs, and links. CSS controls the visual presentation, including colors, fonts, and layouts. JavaScript adds dynamic behavior, enabling user interactions and data manipulation. Modern web development also includes frameworks like React, Angular, and Vue.js that simplify complex applications. Understanding these fundamentals is essential for anyone looking to build modern, responsive websites.

title: JavaScript Fundamentals
description: Master JavaScript concepts with practical examples and hands-on coding

title: HTML Basics Quiz
description: Test your HTML knowledge with interactive questions and immediate feedback

What is the correct HTML tag for inserting an image?

title: React.js Complete Guide
description: Comprehensive guide to building modern web applications with React.js
content: React.js is a powerful JavaScript library for building user interfaces, particularly single-page applications. Created by Facebook, React uses a component-based architecture that makes code reusable and maintainable. Key concepts include JSX (JavaScript XML) for writing component templates, state management for handling dynamic data, and props for passing data between components. React's virtual DOM efficiently updates the user interface by comparing changes and updating only what's necessary. Hooks like useState and useEffect provide functional components with state and lifecycle capabilities. Modern React development often includes tools like Create React App for quick setup, React Router for navigation, and state management libraries like Redux or Context API for complex applications.

description: Master modern CSS layout techniques with Grid and Flexbox

title: Node.js Backend Development
description: Learn server-side JavaScript development with Node.js and Express
content: Node.js enables JavaScript development on the server side, allowing developers to use the same language for both frontend and backend. Built on Chrome's V8 engine, Node.js uses an event-driven, non-blocking I/O model that makes it efficient for handling concurrent requests. Express.js is the most popular Node.js framework, providing a minimal and flexible web application framework with robust features for web and mobile applications. Key concepts include middleware for request processing, routing for handling different endpoints, and integration with databases like MongoDB or PostgreSQL. Node.js is ideal for building REST APIs, real-time applications with WebSockets, and microservices architectures. Package management through npm (Node Package Manager) provides access to thousands of open-source modules.

A unique identifier for each record

title: Machine Learning Fundamentals
description: Introduction to machine learning concepts, algorithms, and applications
content: Machine Learning (ML) is a subset of artificial intelligence that enables systems to learn and improve from experience without being explicitly programmed. There are three main types: supervised learning (using labeled data), unsupervised learning (finding patterns in unlabeled data), and reinforcement learning (learning through rewards and penalties). Common algorithms include linear regression for prediction, decision trees for classification, clustering for grouping similar data, and neural networks for complex pattern recognition. The ML workflow involves data collection, preprocessing, feature selection, model training, evaluation, and deployment. Popular tools include Python libraries like scikit-learn, TensorFlow, and PyTorch. Applications span across industries: recommendation systems, image recognition, natural language processing, fraud detection, and autonomous vehicles. Understanding statistics, linear algebra, and programming is essential for effective machine learning implementation.
